page.title: 16Calver Sough Housing.
page.content: Housing at Calver Sough, in the North East corner of the area, is quite unlike the rest of the block. Except for one house at 238749 and a number of properties between 240744 and 240747 (on the western end of the old village) all housing is post 1920 and suburban in style, either rendered, or stone (rarely), or stone-faced, or faced in a material like stone. Development roads generally appear to comply with standard suburban new street widths, though short stretches of old lane remain. The A623 has tall steel lamp standards producing an orange light alongside thehouses. The style and character contrasts with the traditional character which the Peak National Park now increasingly demands.
